content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

Here is how you can define a `show` method in Julia:
```julia
struct FloatWithUnits{T<:Real}
    value::T
    unit::String
end

Base.show(io::IO, x::FloatWithUnits) = print(io, "$(x.value) $(x.unit)")
```
This defines a `show` function that will take an IO stream and a FloatWithUnits object as input. It then prints out the value of the FloatWithUnits object followed by the unit. 

You can now test this with:
```julia
julia> x = FloatWithUnits(1.8, "meters")
FloatWithUnits{Float64}(1.8, "meters")

julia> show(stdout, x)
1.8 meters
```
